CheckTitle: IAM account password policy enforces password expiration within 90 days or less
CheckType: Software and Configuration Checks/Industry and Regulatory Standards/CIS AWS Foundations Benchmark
Description: **IAM account password policy** sets a **password expiration period** for IAM user console logins; configuration is aligned when rotation is enabled and set to `<= 90` days.
Risk: Without rotation, stale passwords persist, enabling **credential stuffing**, **brute force**, and **password reuse** attacks. A compromised IAM user can retain console access, enabling **data exfiltration**, privilege escalation, and loss of **confidentiality** and **integrity**.

Code.NativeIaC:
```yaml
# CloudFormation: Set IAM account password policy to expire passwords within 90 days
Resources:
  ExampleAccountPasswordPolicy:
    Type: AWS::IAM::AccountPasswordPolicy
    Properties:
      MaxPasswordAge: 90  # Critical: enforces password expiration in 90 days or less to pass the check
```
Code.Other:
1. In the AWS Console, go to IAM
2. Select Account settings
3. In Password policy, click Edit
4. Check Enable password expiration and set Password expiration period (days) to 90 or less
5. Click Save changes

Recommendation.Text: Enforce **password rotation** at `<= 90` days and **prevent reuse**. Pair with **MFA**, strong length/complexity, and prefer **federation/SSO** to reduce static passwords. Apply **least privilege**, monitor sign-ins, and remove inactive console passwords to limit exposure.
